commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Excuse me.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What are you all doing here today?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We're here about using Nijigasaki High School as the venue for the School Idol Festival, and would like to talk to you about it again.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: So that's why you're here... I am quite sure I made myself clear about not being able to give you permission.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'm sorry we flooded you with our grand plans without any proper preparations before. We got together with μ's and Aqours after that and realized why you couldn't approve.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I see. Then please desist your plans to use the school. No matter how wonderful the ideas may be behind this event, I cannot have you interfering with other clubs.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: About that. We've already gotten approval from all of the clubs and associations.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What? All of them?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Also, please look at this.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What is this?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Signatures of everyone who has given their endorsement of the School Idol Festival.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I cannot believe this. What a surprise. Are you saying you have been endorsed by ninety percent of the whole school?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: While it was not an easy task, our club president led the way as we all went around the school collecting signatures.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You received this much support in such a short amount of time?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: This is the result of everyone's hard work.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You must have paved the way for this with your leadership. Now I want you to be a part of the student council more than ever before.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Can we use the school? Rina-chan Board says, "Stare."

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: *Sigh* I underestimated your collective passion. There is no way I can ignore it.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: So that means...!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Do not get the wrong idea. I have only recognized your passion and results. However, I really cannot give you permission to use the school as the venue for the event.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Aww, what? We can't? I think we worked pretty hard for this.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I will admit that your negotiation skills are excellent, however, that does not necessarily mean you can manage an event. You cannot do this entirely on your own.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: As your student council president, I cannot allow myself to support you in a cause that I know will fail.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: You mentioned event management, right? We really have put a lot of serious thought into this, Shioko.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: We've come up with a management plan with the help of everyone from μ's and Aqours. Could you have a look at this, too?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I will indeed.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We put this together with a focus on how we're going to use the school, the flow of traffic, how many staff we'll need, emergency procedures, and how past events of this size were run.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: It'd be great if you could tell us how security is handled at the school since we don't actually know the particulars about that.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I see... The art and theater clubs for construction; the broadcasting and music clubs and the band for sound; and the cooking club and life design students for refreshments.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You will also have assistance from other schools? Then this will also act as a form of joint practice or inter-regional competition between clubs.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Does this mean you pulled the other clubs and associations in rather than actually persuading them?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Not at all, Shioriko.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: All of the clubs voluntarily approached us!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Yup, yup! They all wanted to join in on the fun!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Because we all just LOVE having fun!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: By the way, we also have some students outside of the life design course who want to join in and volunteer. You can find those details on the next page.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You have the support of so many students...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yup! This many students want to offer their support for the School Idol Festival.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: This isn't just the dream of our club anymore. The School Idol Festival has become the dream of all the Nijigasaki High School students.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: The dream of all Nijigasaki High School students?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That is why I think Nijigasaki High School is the perfect place to hold the event.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Well, Shioriko? Do you still not approve?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I believe this proposal is extremely well put together. I can feel your...no, the whole school's true passion.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Then that means...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: However, I still cannot allow this to go ahead!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Oh, come on! What are we missing?! Spit it out! Anything! We won't give up until we get your approval, Shio-ti!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Yes, we will resolve whatever it is we're missing!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: No matter how complete your management proposal may look, it will only work in theory. It will not actually go according to plan in reality.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: For example, the number of volunteers you will need on the day to hold the event.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: It says here that you will need the same number as the previous School Idol Festival; one thousand people. Do you actually know how large a number that is?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: About the same number of students per grade at this school, right?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: We should be able to easily gather that many people. I mean, it's school idol lovers we're talking about here.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: If that is what you think, then gather that many people by the deadline. I will give in and promise to offer my full cooperation if you manage to do that.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: What, really?!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: However, you must give up on trying to hold the School Idol Festival if you cannot do this. Do you agree to this condition?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: W-Well...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: You are not going to reject my condition, are you?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: It's okay. I believe we can do this.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: As do I!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Go on, you should speak up as well!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You guys...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Okay. We accept your condition. We'll get one thousand people by the deadline!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: That's a promise. Understood?
